summary: This document is an email chain from August 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing a potential interview with a new victim who reported being sexually assaulted by Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails coordinate scheduling and discuss the strategy of waiting until after Maxwell's trial to conduct the interview, while also mentioning two other victims from the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the underlying case; a new victim reported being sexually assaulted by her. Prosecutors discuss waiting until after her trial to interview this new victim.

events.title: Tentative interview scheduled
events.description: A tentative interview with a victim (related to a spinoff from the Maxwell case) was scheduled for this date, as mentioned in an earlier email from May 2021.

events.title: Prosecutors discuss new victim interview
events.description: Prosecutors correspond about a new victim who reported being sexually assaulted by Ghislaine Maxwell and discuss the plan to interview her after Maxwell's trial.

keyFacts: A new victim reported being sexually assaulted by Ghislaine Maxwell, as communicated by the victim's attorney to a prosecutor in August 2021.
Prosecutors discussed a plan to wait until after Maxwell's trial to interview this new victim.
The emails reference two other victims from the Epstein investigation who were assaulted by Maxwell and discussed it during their initial FBI interviews.
The correspondence shows coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a spinoff investigation from the Maxwell case.
All identifiable names of prosecutors and agents are redacted, indicated by placeholders like (USANYS).
